026package com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns;
027
028import java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService;
029import java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture;
030import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
031import java.util.logging.Logger;
032
033import com.ibm.streams.operator.OperatorContext;
034import com.ibm.streams.operator.logging.TraceLevel;
035import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.Parameter;
036import com.ibm.streams.operator.state.ConsistentRegionContext;
037
038/**
039 * Abstract pattern class for an operator that produces tuples by polling an
040 * external source for information and converting that information into outgoing
041 * tuples. This class just provides the mechanism for polling, sub-classes
042 * implement fetchTuples() which will be called at the polling frequency.
043 * 
044 * 
045 */
046public abstract class PollingTupleProducer extends TupleProducer {
047
048    /**
049     * SPL Trace facility
050     */
051    private final static Logger trace = Logger.getLogger(PollingTupleProducer.class.getName());
052    private long pollFrequency = 1;
053    private TimeUnit pollFrequencyUnit = TimeUnit.SECONDS;
054
055    /**
056     * Get the polling frequency, defaults to 1.
057     * 
058     * @return Current frequency.
059     */
060    public final synchronized long getPollFrequency() {
061        return pollFrequency;
062    }
063
064    /**
065     * Get the unit for the polling frequency, defaults to SECONDS.
066     * 
067     * @return Unit for polling frequency.
068     */
069    public final synchronized TimeUnit getPollFrequencyUnit() {
070        return pollFrequencyUnit;
071    }
072
073    /**
074     * Set the polling frequency. Must be called in a sub-class's initialize()
075     * to have an effect as the values are read by startProcessing().
076     * 
077     * @param pollFrequency
078     *            Polling frequency.
079     * @param unit
080     *            Unit of the polling frequency.
081     */
082    public final synchronized void setPollFrequency(long pollFrequency,
083            TimeUnit unit) {
084        this.pollFrequency = pollFrequency;
085        this.pollFrequencyUnit = unit;
086    }
087    
088    /**
089     * Sets the polling period in seconds from the
090     * optional operator parameter {@code float64} parameter {@code period}.
091     * Resolution from the value is milliseconds.
092     * @param period Polling period in seconds.
093     */
094    @Parameter(optional=true,
095            description="Polling period in seconds. Tuples will be fetched every `period` seconds.")
096    public void setPeriod(double period) {
097        setPollFrequency((long) (period * 1000.0), TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
098    }
099
100    private ScheduledFuture<?> future;
101    
102    /**
103     * {@inheritDoc}
104     */
105    @Override
106    public void initialize(OperatorContext context) throws Exception {
107        super.initialize(context);
108    }
109    
110    /**
111     * {@inheritDoc}
112     * <P>
113     * Starts processing by scheduling a fixed rate task that will call
114     * fetchTuples() at the configured poll frequency.
115     * </P>
116     */
117    @Override
118    public synchronized void allPortsReady() throws Exception {
119        
120        final long delay = getPollFrequencyUnit().convert(
121                getInitialDelay(), getInitialDelayUnit());
122        
123        trace.log(TraceLevel.DEBUG, "initialDelay="+getInitialDelay()+" "+getInitialDelayUnit());
124        trace.log(TraceLevel.DEBUG, "pollFrequency="+getPollFrequency()+" "+getPollFrequencyUnit());
125        trace.log(TraceLevel.DEBUG, "delay="+delay);
126        
127        final Runnable tupleFetcher = new InvokeFetchTuples();
128        final Runnable scheduledTupleFetcher;
129        final ConsistentRegionContext crc = getOperatorContext().getOptionalContext(ConsistentRegionContext.class);
130        if (crc == null) {
131            scheduledTupleFetcher = tupleFetcher;          
132        } else {
133            scheduledTupleFetcher = new Runnable() {
134
135                @Override
136                public void run() {
137                    if (crc.getSubmissionSemaphore().tryAcquire()) {
138                        try {
139                            tupleFetcher.run();  
140                        } finally {
141                            crc.getSubmissionSemaphore().release();
142                        }
143                    }                  
144                }
145                
146            };
147        }
148
149        future = getOperatorContext().getScheduledExecutorService()
150                .scheduleAtFixedRate(scheduledTupleFetcher,
151                                delay, getPollFrequency(), getPollFrequencyUnit());
152    }
153    
154    private class InvokeFetchTuples implements Runnable {
155        @Override
156        public void run() {
157            if (trace.isLoggable(TraceLevel.TRACE))
158                trace.log(TraceLevel.TRACE,
159                        PollingTupleProducer.this.getClass().getName()+ ".fetchTuples()");
160            try {
161                fetchTuples();
162            } catch (Exception e) {
163                trace.log(TraceLevel.ERROR, e.toString(), e);
164                throw new RuntimeException(e);
165            }
166        }
167    }
168        
169    /**
170     * Instead of using <code>TupleProducer.startProcessing</code>
171     * to implement the initial delay, use the delay parameter of
172     * <code>ScheduledExecutorService.scheduleAtFixedRate</code>.
173     * 
174     * @see ScheduledExecutorService#scheduleAtFixedRate(Runnable, long, long, TimeUnit)
175     * @see TupleProducer#allPortsReady()
176     */
177    @Override
178    protected final void startProcessing()
179    {
180    }
181
182    /**
183     * Called periodically to fetch tuples from an external source and submit
184     * them to the output stream(s). Implementations will typically access
185     * the external source to fetch the available data, create OutputTuples
186     * based upon the data, submit them to the output ports and then return.
187     * <BR>
188     * Implementation must not block.
189     * <P>
190     * When in a {@link ConsistentRegionContext consistent region} a
191     * submission permit is acquired before {@code fetchTuples()} is
192     * invoked and released once it completes.
193     * </P>
194     */
195    protected abstract void fetchTuples() throws Exception;
196    
197    /**
198     * Complete the operator by canceling the periodic task
199     * that calls <code>fetchTuples</code>.
200     */
201    protected synchronized void complete() throws Exception {
202        if (future != null) {
203            future.cancel(false);
204            future = null;
205        } 
206    }
207
208    /**
209     * Complete this operator by canceling the
210     * periodic task that implements the polling.
211     * <P>
212     * Sub-classes <b>must</b> call
213     * <code>super.shutdown()</code> if they override this method.
214     * </P>
215     */
216    @Override
217    public void shutdown() throws Exception {
218        complete();
219        super.shutdown();
220    }
221}
